III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was injured by a staff member.
Investigation The Program Supervisor was interviewed on 04/11/2024 during
a face-to-face, unannounced visit to the facility. He reported there
had been an incident involving the use of restraint with Youth A
that had occurred on 04/03/2024, pre-dating the report of the
allegations by six days. This was the last documented physical
incident for Youth A. It was reported this incident occurred in an
office area of the building that is not covered by security cameras.
Documentation of this incident was provided.
DHHS Worker 2 reported in email documentation on 04/10/2024
that face-to-face contact had been made with Youth A on
04/09/2024. There were no visible bruises or injuries to Youth A
at that time. Youth A stated to that worker there was another
youth that was nearby when they spoke that had hit him and this
caused a bruise that had since receded. Youth A denied talking
more about the incident and did not share any details.
Youth A was interviewed on 04/11/2024 during a face-to-face,
unannounced visit to the facility. Youth A did not want to speak
for this investigation and only stated there was a time recently that
another staff member threw a hairbrush at him. This allegation
was addressed in Licensing Special Investigation #
2024SIC0001213. Youth A denied he had been hit or injured by
any staff, or other youth, recently. Youth A did not have any
visible bruising or injuries at the time of this contact.
2

DHHS Worker 1 reported on 04/16/2024 that she had face-to-face
contact with Youth A on that same date. During this interview
Youth A stated the only recent time he had been hit or injured
while at the facility was during an altercation with another youth.
The Complainant was interviewed over the phone on 04/30/2024.
She confirmed she had seen Youth A face-to-face on 04/04/2024
and had seen a visible bruise on Youth A’s cheek, and that same
day Youth A reported to her, “staff did it.” Youth A did not provide
any other details. The Complainant was concerned about the
unexplained bruise to Youth A’s cheek and reported concern that
Youth A struggled with accuracy and truthfulness in his
recollection of past incidents. These allegations were then
reported on 04/08/2024.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone on 06/05/2024. She
reported being present for the 04/03/2024 incident involving Youth
A. Staff 1 recalled Youth A was in an office area for a meeting
and his behavior escalated. This involved him crawling under
desk spaces and pulling on wires and cords. She also recalled he
was attempting to hit nearby staff with office equipment. She
stated Youth A was restrained but that she was not a direct
participant in this intervention. She recalled not seeing any visible
injuries or bruises to Youth A at that time. Staff 1 did not witness
any action of staff that would have caused injury to Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone on 06/06/2024. He stated
he was involved in the restraint incident with Youth A on
04/03/2024. He was not involved with Youth A until coming to the
situation to see him attempting to bite other staff. Staff 2 stated
Youth A was on his back on the ground when the restraint attempt
began, and he was attempting to kick and bite. Staff 2 stated this
did not last long and Youth A was able to commit to safety. Staff 2
stated another restraint attempt occurred when Youth A was
moving back to his unit. He did not recall seeing anything that
would have caused bruising to Youth A’s face. Staff 2 noted they
are trained to avoid any close contact with a youth’s face during a
restraint to avoid attempts at being bit.
Staff 3 was interviewed over the phone on 06/06/2024. He
recalled being a part of the restraint attempt of Youth A from
04/03/2024. Staff 3 recalled Youth A exhibiting unsafe behaviors
with office equipment and because they were in a unique setting,
staff felt the need to attempt to restrain him for his safety. Staff 3
stated the restraint attempt was brief and Youth A initially fought
back but was able to return to a calm and safe state. Staff 3 did
3

not see any bruising at that time. Staff 3 did not believe there was
any action of staff during this incident that would have caused
injury to Youth A.
It was confirmed the investigation authored by DHHS Worker 1
did not produce any findings.
Documents reviewed:
• An incident report dated 04/03/2024 was provided and
reviewed. This was authored by Staff 1. The incident
report described events consistent with interviews in this
investigation. Youth A was seen by the facility nurse on the
same date at 4:45 pm and it was documented that Youth A
denied any injury but that there was a small abrasion to the
side of his jaw. No treatment for the abrasion was
recommended.
• A separate incident report dated 04/03/2024 at 8:15 pm
was provided and reviewed. In this report it was
documented that Youth A had been banging his own head
against a cabinet in his room. He was assessed by the
facility nurse that same date at 8:30 pm and no concerns or
treatment were noted.
• Nursing notes documenting the same dates and incidents
were provided and reviewed and no inconsistent
information was noted.
• Policies & procedures from the facility titled “Emergency
Restraint” were reviewed. These were last revised as of
07/18/2022. This policy requires staff to perform restraints
in a manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to
the severity of a child’s behavior.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as there was not evidence
found to show that Youth A was injured as a result of any staff
involvement during incidents.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
